intro: Echidnopsis scutellata subsp. dhofarensis, commonly known as the Dhofar echidnopsis, is a succulent plant native to the Arabian Peninsula. It is characterized by its cylindrical, ribbed stems and produces small, star-shaped yellow flowers. The plant thrives in arid and semi-arid environments, often found in rocky soils. It is well-adapted to withstand high temperatures and low rainfall. Its unique morphology and habitat make it a distinctive species within the Crassulaceae family.
